(a) \( \varphi(x)=A \tan x \)
(b) \( \varphi(x)=B \cos x \)
(c) \( \varphi(x)=C \exp \left(-D / x^{2}\right) \)
(d) \( \varphi(x)=E x \exp \left(-F x^{2}\right) \)

questions.ocrQuestion:
Which of the following is an allowed wavefunction for a particle in a bound state? (where \( N \) is a constant and \( \alpha, \beta>0 \) )
(a) \( \psi(x)=N \frac{e^{-\alpha x}}{x^{3}} \)
(b) \( \psi(x)=N\left(1-e^{-\alpha x}\right) \)
(c) \( \psi(x)=N e^{-\alpha x} e^{-\beta\left(x^{2}+y^{2}+z^{2}\right)} \)
(d) \( \psi(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\text { non-zero constant } & \text { if } x < R \\ 0 & \text { if } x>R\end{array}\right. \)

\[
\psi(x)=N \exp [-\alpha|x|] \quad(\alpha \text { is positive real constant })
\]
where \( N \) is normalization constant. What is the value of \( N \) ?
(a) \( \sqrt{2 / \alpha} \)
(b) \( \sqrt{2 \alpha} \)
(c) \( \sqrt{1 / \alpha} \)
(d) \( \sqrt{\alpha} \)
